222747439.description:
A group discussion around the topic of how would schools be in 21st century. Facilitated by Atul Veer, who will guide us through his research on the topic.

- A good look at current education system and challenges we face.
- Understanding what school is for.
- How should we teach ourselves and our kids in 21st Century?

It would be great if you watch following videos before coming to the meetup! 

1. Sir Ken Robinson's talk on Changing education Paradigms .

https://youtu.be/ATCqh-OjSuw?list=PLbRLdW37G3oMquOaC-HeUIt6CWk-FzaGp

2. Sir Ken Robinson's talk on schools

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iG9CE55wbtY

3. Hindi documentary on Shri Dayalchand Soni - with English subtitles.  He talks about basic education and on why education? 

https://vimeo.com/18230123

4. John Holt's ideas on education and children

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qKmSfvtdZaM

venue.address1: 402A, Town Square, Airport Road, Viman Nagar
venue.address2: Landmark: Above Dorabjee's, on the 4th Floor
venue.name: Doo

222747439.title: Schools of the 21st Century.

235342368.description:
A speakers’ conclave, titled thesmallx - A Mad Tea Party, is being organised as part of Karavaan, the annual Social, Scientific and Cultural festival of the institute.

thesmallx is a talk series comprising of seven speakers whose expertise span a diverse set of fields. The event is unique in the sense that it provides a common platform, for discussion of very distinct ideas, tied together by the theme of Wonder.


Date: November 6, 2016                       Time: 2.00 pm to 5.00 pm


Venue: Sir CV Raman Auditorium, IISER Pune


The talks are open to all and free.

The confirmed list of speakers along with the titles of the talks:


- Understanding Quorum Sensing and Evolutionary Biology to Shape our Future Policies


Anand Gandhi Filmmaker and Founder of India's first Virtual Reality Lab


- Comics: The gateway to your own wonderland


Mitali Panganti Illustrator and Webcomic Artist

- Wonderful Heritage of Pune

Prajakta Panshikar Heritage Conservationist, Founder of ‘Pune Heritage Walk’


- Phalke and the Wonder of Indian Cinema

Kamal Swaroop Filmmaker and Film Historian


- Using Football as a Tool for Social Development

Abhijeet Barse Social Entrepreneur, Founder of Slumsoccer


- The Potential of Design Industry in India

Sathish Narayanan Designer and Entrepreneur

- Perception of Cities through Cinema

Anil Zankar Filmmaker and Film-writer

http://www.iiserpune.ac.in/events/Talks+by+Seven+Eminent+Speakers+at+Karvaan

venue.name: IISER Pune Dr. Homi Bhabha road,

235342368.title: IISER Post: thesmallx - A Mad Tea Party (Talks by Seven Eminent Speakers)

171528132.description:
In 2004 DHH announced the initial release for Rails. This year marks ten years since its release.

Let's celebrate this occasion by holding a launch party on 26th April 2014.

Rails 4.1 will be out at Railsconf this year. Considering that there have been major changes from 3x onwards to 4.0 - 4.1, we plan to do a small workshop, focusing on new features with 4.1.

The workshop will focus on new things like:

• Reviewing ActiveRecord concepts.

• Mailer Preview

• Message Verifier

• JSON Encoder changes

• Security changes like secrets.yml

• Spring/Binstubs etc

Ruby 2.1.1 also turns a page with exciting new features. We'll try to go briefly over some of them.

Come join us for the workshop and Rails 4.1 Launch party, celebrating 10 years of Rails!

UPDATE: There will be Lunch and Cake, sponsored by BigBinary and Revealing Hour Creations. Thanks to these amazing folks!

venue.address1: 402A, Town Square, Airport Road, Viman Nagar
venue.address2: Landmark: Above Dorabjee's, on the 4th Floor
venue.name: Doo

171528132.title: 10 years of Rails + 4.1 Launch Party.

240356503.description:
Please use this link to buy tickets. Only RSVP dose not guarantee a spot for the workshop.
https://www.instamojo.com/dronaaviation/pluto-drone-workshop-pune/ 

One day workshop to familiarize the participants with drones, teach them basics and intricacies of a Quadrotor, enable them to build a palm sized drone themselves and experience the pleasure of flying self­-built drone.

What will students learn from workshop?

● Principles of operation of multi­rotors
● Hands-­on experience with building aerial vehicles
● Flying self-­built UAVs
● Troubleshooting

Things to carry - Smartphone/Tablet with app “Pluto Controller ” installed.

Course details
Full day – 10:00 a.m. – 4:30 p.m. with lunch Time at 12:45PM - 1:45PM (We won't provide Lunch)
Workshop Fee: Rs. 1,500
Age: 10+


We will provide the necessary Pluto kit using which participant will build a drone Pluto. In the end of the workshop, you have to return the drone.
If you want to take the Pluto home, you need to pay Rs. 5000 extra.

Course Activities
Mechanics of flying vehicles
Stable systems vs unstable systems
How does propeller work: Change thrust by speed/ angles, Types of aerial vehicles
Aeroplanes: Why is Aeroplane stable, Is man a stable / unstable systems?
Multirotors: Types of drones, functionality and applications
Helicopter - How helicopter maneuver
Components of Quadcopter
Motor: Brushed / Brushless / Servo Motor, Parameters of Motor, PWM
Propellers: How does a fan / propeller works
Battery: Types of batteries, Why LiPo / Parameters of LiPo
Building a nano drone Pluto
Flying Pluto with Smartphone

venue.address2: Syngenta Lane, Near Moze College, Near MITCON College
venue.name: Doo.Space

240356503.title: Build a Nano Drone(Paid)

233607576.description:
https://www.meetup.com/ThoughtChain/events/233607100/


When you are aware and in control of your emotions, you can think clearly and creatively, manage stress and challenges and display confidence. BUT LOSE CONTROL OF YOUR EMOTIONS, and you will spin into confusion, isolation and doubt.It doesn’t matter if you are a business leader, a university student, an exhausted parent or a child setting out on your first schooling experience; YOUR emotions matter! 


Let us meet, discuss and understand through some visuals and tune in to our emotions. 


(It is a free event)https://www.meetup.com/ThoughtChain/events/233607100/

venue.address2: Syngenta Lane, Near Moze College, Near MITCON College
venue.name: Doo.Space

233607576.title: Cross Post: Loose E-motions (An audio-visual on what loose emotions can lead to)

Are you ready to build something innovative with the
Intel® IoT Developer Kit?
If you're a maker, an IoT startup, a developer, a student or a hardware novice, join Intel® IoT Roadshows for a two day hackathon to get your free Intel® IoT Developer Kit, which includes an Intel® Edison board and begin building something awesome! Join this exploration of the Internet of Things.
Use this code IOTPU12 to sign up.

Log on to http://www.iothackathon.net/

For further information, please contact
Leonard [masked] | [masked]

179548542.description:
There is a Paper's We Love meetup group.

We really like the concept and want to see how it works here in our community.

So, I want to propose we do a meetup around the theme.

Summarized :

What was the last paper within the realm of computing you read and loved? What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss.

If you have read a paper and found it really interesting and want share your thoughts on it - welcome!

Hints for Computer System Design, Presented by Neeran


Does this sound fun?

venue.address1: 402A, Town Square, Airport Road, Viman Nagar
venue.address2: Landmark: Above Dorabjee's, on the 4th Floor
venue.name: Doo

179548542.title: Paper's we love #1

234588135.description:
Arduino Kids - Level 1 (Getting Started) (Paid Event)

From Users to Makers

Introduce kids to exciting world of Physical Programming with Arduino and enable them to create their own gadgets, smart machines and robots.

Why Programming?

·  It helps developing logic

·  Develops computational thinking

·  Enhance creativity

Why Arduino?

·  Physical actions in real world excite kids

·  Make interactive objects for their school projects

·  Learn basics of electronics and robotics

What kids will learn?

·  Introduction of “real” programming language

·  Familiarization with the Arduino and IOT

·  Making software interact with real world

What would I need?

·  Arduino kit and other required hardware will be provided

·  You would need to bring a laptop along with you.

Is my kid ready?

·  There is no minimum age if the kid is computer savvy (which most kids are).

·  We recommend this for age group of 10+.

Who is the Trainer?

I am programmer & software architect with 17+ years of experience. I am passionate about teaching programming to kids and enjoy watching them come up with crazy ideas.

When & Where?

Date and Time: Sunday 16 Oct. 10 AM to 1:00 PM (and longer if kids want to experiment more)

Location: Taksh Doo.Space, Balewadi, Pune

Location Info:   http://goo.gl/6xhtGj

Google Map:   http://goo.gl/GbeZFI

Fees?

Rs. 350 per kid. (Parents can join free subject to space availability)

venue.address2: Syngenta Lane, Near Moze College, Near MITCON College
venue.name: Doo.Space

234588135.title: Arduino Kids - Level 1 (Getting Started) (Paid Event)

166312532.description:
http://gmrt.ncra.tifr.res.in/~sciday/sciday/scienceday.htm

February 28th is celebrated as National Science Day all over the country, commemorating the discovery of the Raman Effect by C.V. Raman, for which he was awarded the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1930.

Each year, Science Day is celebrated at the Giant Metrewave Radio Telescope (GMRT) observatory at Khodad. The GMRT, which is the world's most powerful telescope operating at low radio frequencies, was built and is being operated by the National Centre for Radio Astrophysics (NCRA) of the Tata Institute of Fundamental Research (TIFR). '

---

Let's plan to visit GMRT on 28th?
166312532.title: Visit to GMRT on Science Day at Khodad, Junnar, Pune
